subject: Investing
title: Position Sizing for Risk Control
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Position Sizing for Risk Control.

hook.text: A trader bet 40% of his portfolio on one stock pick. It fell 50%. His entire portfolio dropped 20% overnight.

buildup.text: Position sizing decides what percentage of your portfolio goes into any single investment.

discovery.text: A common rule: never let a single position exceed 5% of your total portfolio to limit damage.

twist.text: Concentrated bets create billionaires, but survivorship bias hides the thousands who went broke.

climax.text: Professional risk managers size positions based on volatility: riskier assets get smaller allocations.

punchline.text: How much you buy matters as much as what you buy.

quiz.question: What is a common maximum position size rule?
